channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Sunken cover, 18th September
item.description:
On pavement outside number 30 Greatfield Lane. Work has been completed today and freshly paved up to the cover - however there is a significant dip which poses a trip hazard to pedestrians and a danger to children riding bikes/scooters. It also poses a risk to buggies and wheelchair users which could easily be tipped.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 34, Greatfield Lane, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: As shown in photos job was not complete, 18th September
item.description:
The fly tipped items are all still in place! The worker has even added to the lack of access in the one pathway by leaving his cuttings where they fell on the floor! I don’t think the council or whoever is responsible for this realises that I was referring to the entire rat run of alleyways and pathways around the estates here. Specifically the one at the back of the school where the school shrubbery is knocking the metal fence down by the weight of it, and the continuous pathway along the brook that runs all the way down to the park on Pilgrove way. It’s a disgrace that these potential enjoyable walks and safer paths to the schools are so unkempt.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Springbank Road, Golden Valley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flyposting on lamppost by New Dawn Homes, 18th September
item.description:
On a lamppost by either the junction between GLoucseter Rd and Malvern Rd, or between GLoucester Rd and Brickfield Drive, New Dawn housing have attached a flyposter advertising their homes. They have flyposted on this road before and had them all removed.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 146, Gloucester Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dog fouling by lamppost on inside pavement, 18th September
item.description:
Dog mess on pavement between houses No 25 and 23, just by the lamppost.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 29, Pilley Lane, Leckhampton, Cheltenham

item.title: The street drain is completely full of debris and weeds. And the cross road rain catcher is also full of debris., 18th September
item.description:
What 3 words are nets.plots.eased

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 3, Church Road, Churchdown, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: There is no sign here, 18th September
item.description:
There is no sign here to show where the adjacent road leads to. I am new to Churchdown and took a wrong turn as there was no sign postage saying where it went. I think it's Bamfurlong Lane, but it's where the garden nursery is. I learned that the road takes you to Badgeworth and Churchdown. Signage would be appropriate for those using vehicles and being able to get to where they're looking for. Thank you so much.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gloucester Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Sign plate is missing (Non illuminating sign)

item.title: Push button gets stuck, 18th September
item.description:
I've noticed a number of times that the push button on the left hand (facing away from the town centre) often gets stuck depressed, leading to the lights continual changing to red. This can be fixed by applying pressure to the button. This has been like this for at least 2 weeks.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rodney Road, Montpellier, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
